info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN MERCER...EAST CENTRAL LAWRENCE...CENTRAL BUTLER...WEST CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND SOUTH CENTRAL CLARION COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 451 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Slippery Rock, or 11 miles northwest of Butler, moving east at 80 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. Some wind up to 30 to 40 mph is also possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Butler, Kittanning, Homeacre-Lyndora, Shanor-Northvue, Slippery Rock, Ford City, West Kittanning, Prospect, Chicora, East Brady, Plain Grove Township, and East Butler. This includes Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 99 and 109. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
